captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

(SINGING) You are
the icing on my cake.

You are the smile
I can't replace.
-Hey everyone.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles

and today may be my all
time favorite video to film

because today we have hit
one million subscribers.
One million subscribers!
I cannot believe it.

It seems like just yesterday
we were starting a channel

and we had a handful
of subscribers.

We're so honored that you guys
come and see us every Sunday

night and check out
our hair videos.

And we are so
thankful to you guys.
One million!
It's crazy.

And to top it all off, it's
on my husband's birthday,

which is like the very
best birthday present
I could ever give him.
So thank you again.
Now onto the hair.

So today I'm going
to teach you how
to do a reverse fishtail braid.

So I've seen pictures of this
roaming around the internet

and I think it's amazing,
but it took me a while
to figure out how to do it.

And then when I did,
it's so simple I
knew I had to teach you guys.

So we started by just putting
her hair into a ponytail.

And I'm going to separate
her hair into two sections.

Now this is very much
like a regular fishtail.

So on a regular fishtail
you'd pick a piece up

from the outside and you'd
cross it over the top

and into the left section,
the opposite section,
and you'd continue do that.

So take a piece
and cross it over.

And you'd go like that
until you create a fishtail.

Now a reverse fishtail,
again, two pieces.

Same thing, you're going to
start with an outside edge.

But instead of going over,
you're going to take that piece

and go under the hair and
over to the other side.

And again, you're going
to the outside piece

and go under and over
to the other side.

Now I'm just going
to forewarn you,

when you first
start this fishtail,

you're going to be
like, this doesn't
look like I'm doing anything.

Because it takes about
three to four inches of hair

before you actually see
this fishtail appear.

And then all of a
sudden it pops out.

And you'll be like,
oh, there it is.

So don't get
discouraged, like right

now, if you can't see anything
but like weird laying hair
because that's very normal.
You'll see why in a few seconds.

So you're just going to
keep getting outside edge,

underneath, outside
edge, back underneath.

And to be honest,
having now done both,

I actually think this one's
easier than a regular fishtail.

I think because the hand
hold is easier for me

for some reason it just
makes the whole braid really
much easier.

When I separate them, you can
see it popping out right there
in the middle.

And you'll see it
appear like magic.

The first couple times
I did it, I'm like,
this isn't even doing anything.
But yes, it is.
So don't get discouraged.
Keep going.

I'm going to try
to speed it up now.

Like any normal fishtail, the
smaller pieces, the longer
it's going to take.

So just be forewarned
fishtails aren't the fastest

hairdo in the book, but
I love the way they look.
And this one's really different.

Even this morning when I did it,
I was practicing on her hair,
and I sent her out.

And I said, hey Bailey,
look at her hair.
What do you think?

And Bailey was like,
whoa, how'd you do that?

Because it's really different
looking and kind of unusual.

I'm not sure everybody knows
it's not a simple hairdo,

like to just see,
because you're used
to seeing the original fishtail.

You can see, now
all of a sudden,
see it popping out at the top?
There you go.
There's the magic.

So we're just going to keep
going all the way down.

And we're going to just
secure it at the end

with an elastic when
we get to that point.
Very simple, but I love it.

OK, when you get
to a point where

you want to stop-- which I
am there-- then just take

an elastic, secure
it at the bottom.

And I'm just going to go back
and just give it a little tug,

just to soften it all up and
loosen it up a little bit.

That gives it a little
bit softer feel.

And then you can finish
it off by putting
a cute bow in their hair.

I'm just going to do this
cute little cream lace
bow that I have at the top.

And you are ready
to rock and roll.

OK, let me spin her so you
can see the finished product.
Ta-da!

You can even mess it
up a little bit more

if you wanted to, for
really soft romantic look.

But again, than you guys
a million for the million.
Ha, ha, that was funny.

And be sure to check out
Brooklyn and Bailey's channel.
It's BrooklynAndBailey.

I'll put a link above, as
well as in the description box
below so you guys can find it.

They are doing a really
cool giveaway right now

for some Mini Mouse
mini mani kit.

It's like a little kit of
nail polishes from OPI.
It's really amazing.

And we will see you
guys next Sunday.
Bye, bye!
-Bye!
[MUSIC PLAYING]

(SINGING) You are
every bit of beautiful.

You are, you are, you are
every bit of beautiful.
-We're almost up to the top.

-Oh, we're almost
at the top again.
Here we go!
Whoa, look down, look down!
Whoa!
You like that?
-Yeah.
-Yeah or no?
-Yeah.
-Was that cool?
Where's Dad?
-Right there.
-There's Dad!
-Hi!
-There's the other girls.
Hey, girls!

title: Reverse {Inverse} Fishtail Braid | Thanks for 1,000,000 Subscribers!
